metadata.title: Zitationsnetzwerk: Digital Humanities Methodendiskurs
metadata.description: Zehn Publikationen aus drei Forschungsclustern mit Zitationsbeziehungen

nodes.title: Distant Reading and the Digital Humanities
nodes.author: Moretti, Franco
nodes.abstract: Proposes computational analysis of large literary corpora as alternative to close reading. Argues for quantitative methods in literary studies.

nodes.title: Graphs, Maps, Trees: Abstract Models for Literary History
nodes.author: Moretti, Franco
nodes.abstract: Introduces visual abstractions for analyzing literary history. Demonstrates network analysis and geographic mapping of literary phenomena.

nodes.title: A Companion to Digital Humanities
nodes.author: Schreibman, Susan et al.
nodes.abstract: Foundational collection defining the field of digital humanities. Covers history, theory, and methods across disciplines.

nodes.title: Digital Humanities and the Study of Antiquity
nodes.author: Bodard, Gabriel
nodes.abstract: Applies digital methods to classical studies. Focuses on epigraphic databases and textual encoding.

nodes.title: The Digital Humanities Manifesto 2.0
nodes.author: Presner, Todd et al.
nodes.abstract: Programmatic statement on the future of digital humanities. Emphasizes collaboration, openness, and interdisciplinarity.

nodes.title: Network Analysis in the Humanities
nodes.author: DÃ¼ring, Marten
nodes.abstract: Systematic introduction to network analysis for historians and literary scholars. Covers centrality measures, community detection, and visualization.

nodes.title: Digital Editions and the Complexity of Remediation
nodes.author: Pierazzo, Elena
nodes.abstract: Examines the theoretical foundations of digital scholarly editing. Discusses TEI encoding and interface design for editions.

nodes.title: Debates in the Digital Humanities
nodes.author: Gold, Matthew K.
nodes.abstract: Collection of essays on contested topics in digital humanities. Addresses questions of disciplinary identity and institutional politics.

nodes.title: Stylometry and Method: The Case of Euripides
nodes.author: Eder, Maciej
nodes.abstract: Applies stylometric analysis to classical authorship attribution. Demonstrates statistical methods on Greek tragedy corpus.

nodes.title: The Historian's Macroscope: Big Data in History
nodes.author: Graham, Shawn et al.
nodes.abstract: Practical guide to computational methods for historians. Covers text mining, topic modeling, and network analysis with tutorials.
